document.heading: National Law Enforcement Museum Sales and Use Tax Credit Act of 2009

history.narrative: Law 18-49, the “National Law Enforcement Museum Sales and Use Tax Credit Act of 2009”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-99, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 2, 2009, and June 16, 2008, respectively. Enacted without signature by the Mayor on June 26, 2009, it was assigned Act No. 18-124 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-49 became effective on September 23, 2009.
